CatDescriptText: Roy S. Lahet was minister of Trinity Lutheran Church, at North Avenue and Buena Vista Street, North Side, from 1969 to 1974. Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 2, 1960, pg. 3 reads: "Picket Line Here Protests Dixie Bias - While a curious throng of onlookers, including some self-styled leaders of the fight for civil rights, watched with interest, approximately 80 men, women and youths threw an effective picket line around the downtown Woolworth store here, in protest against the chain company's acquiescence to the insulting segregation policy at its lunch counters in South. The pickets were led by the Pitt chapter of the NAACP and Chatham College students, upper left photo...Among those unafraid to be counted in the picket line were Atty. Henry R. Smith, state president of the NAACP; Dr. Hugh Cleland, Pitt history professor; Peter D. Hammond, Pitt anthropology professor; the Revs. J.B. Cayce, Ebenezer Baptist Church; Churchill Carter, Park Place AME, Homestead; R. H. Reid, Payne Chapel AME, Duquesne, and J.G. Jarris, Bethel AME, Pittsburgh; Mrs. Marion B. Jordon, Mrs. Paul Knitt, James O. Dougan, Matthew Moore, Regis Bobonis, and The Courier's George E. Barbour and Frank E. Bolden - Harris Photos
TitMainTitle: Men, including minister of Trinity Lutheran Church Roy S. Lahet second from left, and women, picketing outside Woolworth's protesting discrimination at lunch counters, Smithfield Street and Sixth Avenue, Downtown
